title: From Gondwana to Himalaya: India's Long Voyage
summary: India rifted from Gondwana in the Cretaceous, raced north, and collided with Eurasia in a multi-stage process beginning ~59–50 Ma, lifting the Himalaya/Tibet—an ongoing tectonic engine that shapes climate, rivers, soils, biodiversity.

claims.text: India rifted from Gondwana ~120-130 Ma during Cretaceous breakup.
Initial India-Asia collision began ~59-50 Ma with ongoing convergence.
Himalayan uplift intensified monsoon systems from ~23 Ma.

texts.excerpt: हिरण्यगर्भः समवर्तताग्रे भूतस्य जातः पतिरेक आसीत्
texts.translation: Hiranyagarbha arose first - the golden cosmic egg from which all existence emerged

title: Śutudrī to Satadru: Sutlej's Many Beds
summary: Rigveda's Nadīstuti lists Sarasvatī between Yamunā and Śutudrī/Vipāśā, anchoring a northwest geography. Modern work shows the Ghaggar–Hakra palaeochannel is an old course of the Sutlej and that Harappan-era streams east of the Indus were largely monsoon-fed.

claims.text: Ghaggar–Hakra is a former Sutlej valley with pre-urban Harappan avulsion.
Harappan Ghaggar flows were monsoon-fed, not perennial glacial.
Major avulsion completed before mature Harappan urbanism (~4.5 ka).

title: Kāśyapa Drains Satisar: Kashmir's Karewa Lake & Jhelum Outlet
summary: Nilamata Purāṇa remembers a great lake (Satisar) drained by sage Kāśyapa. Geology documents thick Plio-Pleistocene Karewa lacustrine–fluvial deposits and later incision as the Jhelum cut a gorge.

claims.text: Plio-Pleistocene Karewa deposits record a long-lived lacustrine basin.
Jhelum incision through Baramulla gorge drained the ancient lake system.
Lake drainage timeline aligns with Puranic memory of Kāśyapa's intervention.

texts.excerpt: Once the valley was Satisar, a lake; sage Kāśyapa made it fit for men
texts.translation: Kashmir valley transformation from lake to habitable land

title: Earth–Sea Saṅgam: Ports That Moved with the Shoreline
summary: Sangam poems celebrate Kaveripūmpattinam; marine archaeology off Poompuhar shows partial submergence and shoreline shift. Off Dwarka, surveys report structures interpreted as port remains with scholarly caution on interpretations.

claims.text: Poompuhar shoreline has migrated seaward with Cauvery delta progradation.
Submerged structures off Poompuhar indicate former coastal settlements.
Dwarka underwater archaeology interpretations remain debated among scholars.

texts.translation: Kaveri's Poompattinam at the sea port

title: Monsoons, Deltas, and Civilizational Corridors
summary: Late-Holocene aridification stabilized Indus plains and nudged settlement shifts; connects to coastal trade corridors documented in Sangam and archaeology.

claims.text: Late Holocene aridification (~4.2 ka event) affected Harappan settlements.
Coastal trade networks adapted to changing river-delta systems.

title: Reading Room: Influences & Debates
summary: Showcase scholarly approaches from rigorous geology to interpretive frameworks, distinguishing evidence-based claims from speculative reconstructions.

claims.text: Pranay Lal's Indica provides accessible natural history narrative.
Tilak's Arctic Home represents historical interpretation requiring critical evaluation.
